definition: to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
variant of 強|强[jiang4]
variant of 強|强[qiang3]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
variant of 強|强[qiang2]
surname Qiang
stubborn/unyielding
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: If wrong, you just confess, and not contest.
sentences.chinese: 错了就要承认，不要强词夺理。

sentences.english: There was a sophisticated case for this policy.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个政策，还存在着一种强词夺理的见解。

sentences.english: They blustered it out and swore that they were innocent.
sentences.chinese: 他们强词夺理，发誓自己是无辜的。

sentences.english: D. Because he hadn't eaten her fried fish at all.
sentences.chinese: 旅行人根本没吃炸鱼，实属妇女强词夺理。

sentences.english: My sister likes to chop logic with others, because she is very emulative.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹喜欢强词夺理，因为她非常好胜。

sentences.english: He always chops logic with others, believing he is the right one.
sentences.chinese: 他总是强词夺理，认为自己才是对的。

sentences.english: No one can be persuaded by sophistry.

definition: to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to quibble
specious arguments/sophistry
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions/also written 振振有詞|振振有词
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
completely unreasonable
in the wrong
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to talk rubbish
